definition: to help the dying and heal the injured
to save/to assist/to rescue
variant of 救[jiu4]
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help
to injure/injury/wound

sentences.english: He notes most life-saving operations have taken place.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，大部分救死扶伤的手术已经进行完毕。

sentences.english: A physician's sacred duty is to heal the sick.
sentences.chinese: 医生的神圣职责是救死扶伤。

sentences.english: But to be inspirational you don't have to save lives or win medals.
sentences.chinese: 但要鼓舞他人，你并不一定非要救死扶伤或赢取奖牌。

sentences.english: They make it possible for doctors to perform complicated surgery to save lives.
sentences.chinese: 它们让医生们为救死扶伤而进行复杂的手术成为可能。

sentences.english: It is universally acknowledged that it is the doctor’s duty and obligation to heal the wounded and rescue the dying.
sentences.chinese: 全世界都知道救死扶伤是医生的天职。

sentences.english: Saving lives is what doctors should do.
sentences.chinese: 救死扶伤是医生份内的工作。

sentences.english: No President in the field hospital to assist party together to make Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 长孙无蓉在战地医院协助方神医救死扶伤。

sentences.english: The transplanting of human organs has brought about a revolution for our medical treating.
sentences.chinese: 人体器官移植为人类医学救死扶伤带来革命性的变化。

sentences.english: Heal the wounded ,rescue the dying ,practice revolutionary humanitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 救死扶伤，实行革命的人道主义。

sentences.english: In such conditions, we had two years of life-saving work.
sentences.chinese: 就在这样的条件下，我们进行了两年的救死扶伤工作。

definition: to treat the disease to save the patient/to criticize a person in order to help him
practice medicine or pharmacy to help the people or public
"angel in white" (laudatory term for a nurse)
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
medical ethics
kindness/benevolence/to govern in humanitarian way
vocation/duty/mission in life
warrior in white/medical worker
to practice medicine (esp. in private practice)
to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people/altruism
to help those in distress (idiom)
salvation
universal mercy and succor (idiom); the Buddha's infinite power and mercy
to root out the strong and give people peace (idiom); to rob the rich and give to the poor
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
good doctor/skilled doctor
